sections.name: Keyboard Inferno
sections.description: The iconic keyboard intro - rapid E minor arpeggios (E-G-B-E) sweeping up and down, building in intensity. Start sparse, add layers. Ch0: keyboard arpeggios. Ch1: silent then enters with counter-arpeggios. Ch2+Ch3: silent.

sections.name: Guitars Ignite
sections.description: Twin guitars EXPLODE in with the main power riff. Galloping rhythm (dun-dun-DUN dun-dun-DUN). E5 power chord riff with chromatic movement E-F-F#-G. Full double-bass kick drums enter. The keyboard drops to backing.

sections.name: Verse - The Epic Journey
sections.description: Melodic verse section. Guitar 1 plays the verse melody (singable, in E minor pentatonic). Guitar 2 plays palm-muted chugging rhythm (repeated low E with occasional movement). Bass follows root notes. Drums: standard double-time rock beat.

sections.name: Pre-Chorus Rising
sections.description: Building tension. Ascending chord progression Em-C-D-Em moving up. Melody climbs higher each phrase. Drums intensify with fills. Bass walks up chromatically. Everything pushing toward the chorus explosion.

sections.name: Chorus - So Far Away
sections.description: FULL POWER chorus. The iconic soaring melody in G major (the 'so far away' part). Twin guitar harmonies in 3rds (Guitar 1 plays melody, Guitar 2 a 3rd below). Maximum drum intensity. Bass pumping eighth notes on roots.

sections.name: Interlude - Twin Harmony
sections.description: Guitar harmony interlude. Both guitars play harmonized melodic lines in parallel 3rds, weaving through E minor. Slightly less intense than chorus but still powerful. Drums pull back to half-time feel briefly then return.

sections.name: Herman Li Shreds
sections.description: Guitar solo section! Ch0 goes WILD with rapid scalar runs - 16th notes sweeping through E minor, E harmonic minor, chromatic passages. Wide interval leaps, rapid arpeggios. Ch1 plays rhythmic backing chords. Maximum shred energy.

sections.name: Acoustic Calm
sections.description: The famous acoustic breakdown. DRAMATIC shift - strip almost everything away. Guitar 1 plays gentle arpeggiated chords (use keyboard instrument for softer tone). No drums for first half, then gentle hi-hat. Bass plays long sustained notes. Peaceful Am-G-F-E progression.

sections.name: The Rebuild
sections.description: Gradually rebuilding from the acoustic section back to full power. Start with just the clean arpeggios, add bass, add drums one element at a time, guitars get more distorted (switch back to sawtooth/pulse25), accelerating melodic runs building to the final chorus.

sections.name: Final Blaze + Outro
sections.description: Final chorus reprise at MAXIMUM power, then the outro. Chorus melody returns with even more ornamentation. After 8 patterns, begin the outro - descending power chords, drum fills, final sustained E power chord with tremolo. Last 2 patterns fade to silence.
